definition: to hire/to employ/to engage
surname Yan
to prolong/to extend/to delay
to engage (a teacher etc)/to hire/to betroth/betrothal gift/to get married (of woman)
to enlist the services of sb

sentences.english: I am just calling to follow up on the status of the Sales Manager position.
sentences.chinese: 我打電話只是想問一下出賣經理這個職位的延聘狀況。

sentences.english: To participate in the hiring will be, do you want hair?
sentences.chinese: 要參與延聘會了，要不要染髮？

sentences.english: They employed him to look after the baby.
Recruiting Personnel over 70 Years of Age, the Total Term of Employment is Three Years.
sentences.chinese: 延聘七十歲以上者，總聘期不得超過三年。

definition: to employ/to send for sb promising employment
to recruit talent/to round up/to enlist the services of sb
to employ/to recruit (talented personnel)/to gather together (a team)
full-time/to appoint sb to a specific task
to reward and promote
to engage (a teacher etc)/to hire/to betroth/betrothal gift/to get married (of woman)
to hold a teaching position
to invite job applications/to recruit
to appoint (to a position)/appointed
variant of 人才[ren2 cai2]
to supervise (troops)/to appoint (officers)/to select and assign
primary school
office set up in 1914 to compile official history of the Qing dynasty
to accept a position on a provisional basis, in the absence of better qualified candidates (humble expr.)
to set apart/to assign sb to a job
to sign up for an examination/to apply for admission (to a university etc)/to apply (for a position)
